5rAoT7pheo8K_XpR-7i59w.text: Gave it a second try and was very satisfied this time around. Ordered their breakfast burrito,along with the watermelon mint water and of course the chocolate pancakes.

ZM3TJBrWM2erOmafANIpIg.text: It's a good little spot. Steak Korean tacos were tasty. It is a little pricey though for what you get. Staff is friendly. I would go back again.

BUaOGCSg26D4cW9y8XCx5g.text: I'll give 2 stars for the service, which was great! The food I would give 0 stars. I had high hopes after reading the other reviews and receiving an email threw Yelp. I am sad to say the food was just not good at all! I ordered the chicken tacos which looked good when they came out but fell apart when you pick them up and the flavor was just blah. Rice was horrible!!! Looked like white rice with absolutely no flavor. I've never had a Mexican rice that was so bad! My husband ordered a steak burrito. He said literally everywhere else has better burritos then this place. And for $28 it definitely was not worth it. Your better off going to a robertos. I have no idea how they stay in business. I left feeling disappointed and ripped off.

h8S8FcroeOTRNX5VFgbp6A.text: This place is just okay. I ordered steak ontop of tator tots (cant remember the name of the dish). The steak was so tough and i swear it had cinnimon on it. Overpriced as well

MJkXI-hLkENlZqF-g3Umkg.text: Highly recommend! I went here last night and from the moment we walked in, the service was top notch. The cashier (i wish i would have gotten his name), was very helpful, willing to give us any suggestions and was willing to make special accommodations so i could find something i would like (i'm a vegetarian). The food was great, my mother loved the Carnitas which we found out they slow cook for SEVEN HOURS. Even their churros were the best i've had in a while. I will definitely be returning.

30aZZt_AMtY_oQXs_URvuQ.text: Came here for lunch. Nice area and vibe. The food was ok. A lot of cumin spice on carne asada. I ordered a burrito which came with chips and an agua Fresca. $13.00. The agua fresca was very good. The size of the burrito was like a taco. Servings are very small compared to the price. My friend ordered 3 tacos and a drink and it was $16 and tacos were small as well.

ciGn-I3vtIMsqdtngTfTwQ.text: Yeah, they are that good and the salsas are addicting.  I'm kinda hooked on the Me Gusta bowl (big portions!)

DSDW_k_l_0CD4OraCFZzlg.text: Place is great. Had to try all the churros. They do have fillings in them. Yes they do have tacos. All the sauces are on the side and excellent. Very reasonable price. Great for the kids while they are in the splash pad. I do recommend this place just asking you try the churros, better then the one in Disneyland . And way cheaper!

0YC0sX5G7HKwnfklEC73eQ.text: I work in Henderson once or twice a month and always try to stop in here for lunch.  VERY nice, courteous, friendly people and having only been in a few times, they still remember me - which is a nice touch.  I order the "Mission Burrito" but order it without the tortilla and instead as a rice bowl.  This place has to have the best shredded chicken I've ever had....I'm very picky about chicken and the shredded chicken here is what keeps me coming back!  You can tell the ingredients are fresh and high quality, and that they take pride in making things right.  I'll keep coming back when I'm in town!  (And as an added bonus, the owner has an adorable little baby who just happened to be there the last two times I was in visiting...cutest little baby ever!  Made my day!)

htqWAdMfpJund3SE5RhdHw.text: Probably the best Taco/Burrito joint in Henderson/Las Vegas area. Really creative and the food is spot on. Went there looking for just a simple lunch and got so much more. The food quality, and the service were unbeaten. I would pick Me Gusta Tacos over chipotle or any main stream Mexican food place any day the food is just too good. Also the prices match any of those places but the taste exceeds those places. Please check this place out you won't regret it I guarantee it!

jaz5BVDAyNVAUNU34t8L7A.text: Awesome taco joint. Great food, and awesome staff! The portions are solid and the agua fresca flavors are great.

zhctPDLhBhosvJkpKGcKOA.text: Korean taco is bomb, carnitas just ok.  Wonderful service!

yARJyaHxdCv8uSdhzwmFSA.text: This place is awesome. The black bean salad is so yummy and the dressing is to die for. Going to be a regular on my local restaurant rotation.

HHdrxb5pAkDsw_jaER7yOQ.text: Food is tasty with great fresh ingredients, service is friendly and the location in the District is perfect! I had the 3 taco plate; chicken, carne asada & the kalbi. All impressed. Looking forward to trying other menu items!

Cd_nqlT-5TZxzzlFciXM9Q.text: Great fusion tacos at a reasonable price. Don't expect authentic taco styles that you're used to from a taqueria but the food is amazing with its unique little twist. The sauces are delicious. Be careful with the fairly spicy habanero sauce!

AyjyTK5Y-ej-j7pY9a-wxg.text: Food is very tasty and lots of different choices. There are healthy options if you're looking for something lighter. They also have loaded tater tots if you're looking for some yummy junk food. Their agua fresca is delicious. I'm a huge fan of the pineapple basil. They're even better as a sangria. I have become a regular here and have yet to experience anything but excellent customer service. The staff here is extremely friendly and open to questions. They come around and pick up your plates and ask if you need anything else and it's not even a sit down place! I see the owner there often and he is extremely humble and friendly. All I can say is, this place is doing it right!

RyEXAh9jVfaXPBvYBLhzVw.text: This is hands down one of the best places to eat in Henderson. Always good food and always a friendly staff. If you want amazing food and you like things that taste good, you should go here. Never disappointing. Never.

h_D6bW8Gly-uudHkAbCOGg.text: Got two Mission burritos through Uber Eats. Very similar to grilled stuffed burrito from a certain drive thru establishment. Nothing like a Mission district burrito. Carnitas was good. Kalbi was dry. Where are all the ingredients that are supposed to be in here? Not much food for $10. Good salsa. Wouldn't get again. Rip off.

6maJyX8_2peD-8HeMPpZOg.text: Good food, good service, questionable prices if you get anything with shrimp. Just to add a few pieces of shrimp is an added $5 or more. That kinda sucks, especially because the shrimp has obviously been frozen at some point and not very fresh. Very good location and atmosphere! Unless you go Friday and the complex is overrun with children getting out of school.

slyRqObr60TSuRvRq2A6Mg.text: Best carne asada tacos in town. Only gripe is that they close a little too early, at 9.

jVztuvJQ-IrpIEYASgPRHw.text: I love me a good fusion restaurant! We stopped by for a quick bite to eat in between our usual Saturday errands and left with full and happy tummies.   Me Gusta Tacos serves your typical taqueria menu items, except with a twist! The tacos were calling my name, especially seeing as to how they offer items like the Pork Belly Banh Mi and Barbacoa tacos, but I knew I had to order the Stacked Tater Tots after seeing all the tempting photos here on Yelp!  For an extra $3, I was able to top my tots with my choice of protein. I went with the kalbi and oh my god, it was so good! The meat was tender and marinated perfectly. The kalbi was the perfect blend of sweet and savory. Beneath the kalbi was a mound of crunchy, golden Tater Tots covered in melted mild cheddar. To complete the dish, a good squeeze of sour cream and a nice scoop of guac were also added to the top. Stacked Tater Tots are essentially nachos, but way better!  My boyfriend ordered a carne asada California Burrito, per usual, and enjoyed it for the most part. Of course they use Tater Tots instead of the traditional French fries here! His only complaint was that the tortilla began to fall apart while eating it.  We also ordered a Pineapple Basil agua fresca to share, courtesy of Yelp for checking in! The employee taking our order was so friendly and let us sample the other flavors before deciding. It was refreshing! Me Gusta Tacos also serves a variety of beer and wine. There is free water from the cutest tap and also iced tea.  We both agreed that we made a good choice by coming here. The food was great and prices are fair, plus, the customer service was fantastic! I can't wait to come back and try the Bavarian Cream Churros!

9BZguqpdSNpGOr5hlFN3fg.text: I came here on the recommendation of a friend to try tacos. I will say moving from California (orange county, LA area) to Las Vegas has been great minus the mexican food. It is inconsistent, it lacks flavor and I have not found a place even though I have tried to have be THE SPOT.   This location is just like the others- it is Asian fusion and I came here with my friend. We tried almost all the tacos and the nachos. The barbacoa was the best thing on the menu. We tried all the tacos and some (short ribs) disappointed. Some (chicken and carnitas) were dry.   All in all, it was subpar to my food standards. Customer Service was nice and people seemed to like their job! I will not be coming back but if in the area will get the nachos with barbacoa.   Off to find another mexican restaurant that won't disappoint.

8ScFYxRIcayKQmur3glWiA.text: Definitely a place you have to try if you want a bit of a flair. Went in today after seeing the reviews.  Its a small little place inside the district in Henderson. What we ordered: the 6 tacos for $18 (pork belly, korean kalbi, carne asada, and barbacoa). All the tacos fully loaded, with the right seasoning. The pork belly and kalbi, soft and tender which also gave off a sweet taste. They also sell burritos, seafood options, and desserts.   We also both checked in and got a free agua fresca on one order. Best part is, affordable and better than other taco food chain place in town.  Next up, the bavarian churros. Will be back again!!

iBCH8RCaE4EYFLqdgejqCw.text: Stopped here to get out of the local casino at green river valley (nice place, just needed a break).  Had dinner there about 730pm and it was still busy.  Food was excellent!  I had the shrimp tacos and they were very tasty.  Had some nice but minimal seating outside (there is more closer to the splash park but that is more for families/kids.)  They have a limited beer selection, but nice complement to the tacos.  Also, you can grab your salsa according to your taste.  Not very big inside, but clean and well kept.

AoyPd7LTJczPg6V-CR930A.text: We found this place is located in Green Valley District. This store inside is small but for observing I see them have some table outside  surrounding the water place ground for kids. I see most people come here for tacos & we have taco as well. Their food are so delicious with the sauce in the bottle which are self service. The service isn't disappointed us. They come around to ask & ready to make different things if we don't like it.

eo8fLBL7m16idm_ZfwDPdA.text: Great food. However their hours of operation are poppycock. Closed at 9:00 pm. I would eat here every night if they stayed open later!!

zgZaM6E5PRDJNgzJgihopA.text: I've been here a number of times now as it's usually the go-to eatery in The District,  mainly for being convenient and somewhat decently priced.  The menu looks fun while there aren't too many options which is okay, but the flavors are just okay too good, nothing to fall in love with.  I'm a huge fan of tacos and the tacos here usually fall apart and for some reason the flavors don't come together that well.  It's also REALLY bright in here so not really a night time vibe or relaxing loungey vibe... The things I do like are that it's fast, reasonably healthy, and they have beer. There are some stools you can sit and eat at and watch the passers by.  When I'm @ The District I usually eat here or @ Crazy Pita, which is also good but not great. Everything else is too trendy or overpriced.

photos.caption: Photo of Me Gusta Tacos - Henderson, NV, United States

6k6dfAK9_L8M6tSl4rFahQ.text: Not worth the hype. I found this place on Instagram, the food looked so good in photos so I decided to come give it a try. Came here for dinner and there was not one single person eating in there. I tried their fish tacos, korean kalbi tacos and carne asada tacos. Now, keep in mind that I'm a bit picky with my meat. I did not like their meat at all, they contained a "stinky" smell, I believe their meat wasn't fresh at all which is why they carried that funky smell. The meal was also kind of cold when it was served to us.   I definitely had high expection for the korean kalbi and it tasted just as disappointing as the carne asada. The fish taco wasn't too bad but it was cold. I wouldn't recommend this place at all. Go to Tacos el Gordo or Taco y Taco, they won't disappoint.

6XXMbBp1_bZ0FVLXMYWcBQ.text: We ordered from postmates from this place on a night we didn't feel like going out in the heat. The tacos were delicious, the loaded tater tots were delicious, the stuffed churros were amazing. The only reason for a 4 stars instead of 5 is that they forgot to put the fish taco in the bag. It was clearly on the receipt stapled to the bag. That was the taco I was most looking forward to eating.

photos.caption: Photo of Me Gusta Tacos - Henderson, NV, United States. Bavarian cream and caramel churros

YIqaKzX6OeLaBSvUd_2o4Q.text: Staff here are always so kind! I absolutely love their tacos. I do wish they offered margaritas though. However it is still one of my go-to taco places in town.

YXCtHijD1uHA3wBS2aYikg.text: I'm giving a star for the effort and for the service I received the last couple of times.  I think this place is it's a bit Over rated. I'm surprise they have a couple locations.  Good for them! Came here a few times. I'm not impressed, but don't just take it from me. I had to figure out I don't really care for this place after 3 visits. The first time I went I was really hangry. The cashier was polite. Second time I was with family from out of town and it was convenient. Service seemed a little shy and stingy.  The third time was enough. I had 2 fish tacos and 1 asada taco. They wouldn't even give me an extra sauce for my to go order.  The asada was a bit dry, I couldn't put enough limes to hydrate it.  And the fish tacos, I still can't get that fish taste after brushing and washing my mouth a couple times.  I might come back for convenience. Probably in the next 5 years.  On a good note, I can finally take this off my bookmarks of places to try.

photos.caption: Photo of Me Gusta Tacos - Henderson, NV, United States. asada taco was dry

Oei8XEDuz3IMEQZFCpliaA.text: I've got to say by far this is my favorite food place ..!!!! My daughter and I travel from bullhead city 2 x a month and sometimes more, to lovely Henderson. We always stop and dine at Me Gusta I usually order the taco trio and my daughter orders salad or quinoa salad. We love the quality of the food!! Foods very good, great portions and the salsas are fricken amazing. So I kinda don't want to write this review because they'll get too busy.. because they do an amazing job. The guys that work there are super cool  too!!

cFUncLnch6lutuqKpNP2Sg.text: So there's got to be a dozen choices for tacos on every street corner in Vegas but if you want some of the most unique and best around then this is the place to be.  Came here on a late Thursday night right before they closed. I thought they'd be a bit in a hurry to get us out but they were so busy working on orders for pick up they didn't rush us at all.  Heard a lot of talk about this place so I wanted to try a variety. They offer tacos for $3.50 a piece of 3 for $9.50 and that comes with chips.   I went ahead and tried the carne asada taco, fish taco and pastor(pork).  The asada taco was magnificent. Tender juicy succulent pieces of steak cooked perfectly. Grilled to the best way possible and served with onions and cilantro. A True homage to street tacos everywhere. I opted for the flour tortilla at no extra cost.  Next was the fish taco. A simply perfectly grilled piece of fish inside the flour tortilla served with a wasabi aioli and shredded cabbage with some cilantro. Very well done but I'm a fan of the Baja style where it's a chunk of white cod fried but this was exceptional by all means.  Last was the pastor. Perfectly cooked pieces of pork that had been marinated to perfection and served with a pico de gallo.  No wonder this place is so popular. Definitely a step above the rest in cleanliness and appearance. Still a simple taco shop but a safer and more inviting field.

FZbYglPJ8qE93F7H-ATTgw.text: Love this place. Highly recommend the Kalbi in any salad, taco, or burrito. The carne asada was great as well, and the Agua Fresca is some of the best I've had.

SxHb9pYHpUpdiFGkbiJ6ew.text: The store is clean and inviting, and there is covered patio dining outside by the splash pad. The gentleman who worked at the register was super friendly and helpful and gave me samples of their fresh juice and told me about their sangria. It was amazing! I had one with strawberry lemonade, and the other with pineapple basil. I filled up on the tater tot stack, and really enjoyed the fresh salsa/hot sauces you can add yourself.

QU0nLF-YxRh9i0OoT8Yb2Q.text: This was our 1st visit to Me Gusta Tacos and it was great! The atmosphere is pretty simple, but comfy. There are a few high top tables and a handful of booth/chair combo seats. The service was great and the food was tasty. We got a shrimp quesadilla and a carne asada burrito. Both meals came with chips and we added a side of guacamole, which was really fresh. We also tried the strawberry lemonade and it was refreshing and sweet. The only thing we were disappointed in was they don't have white queso dip:( Other than that, it is really good.

Ug_4TUNQM_PFL3Zg1tg_aw.text: Tried the California burrito. The carnitas tasted good and you can't go wrong with tater tots inside. Would definitely go back. Looking forward to trying the churros next time.   Not a very big space, but had a neat atmosphere and friendly staff.

KU3JPjT3nKexR165X5J5cg.text: Delicious, affordable and great location. I got the black bean salad and it was delicious. My husband ordered to loaded quesadiila and enjoyed it. My son, normally a very picky eater, ordered the plain quesadilla and gobbled it. They serve beer and wine and with the location right next to the splash pad it makes for a nice relaxing dinner and activity for the family.

LuZYdwINyHIO4BqIxMBjGA.text: Fresh always. My granddaughter s favorite place for her black bean burrito! On kids menu. And my fav is salad with the added Carnitas.

cnpit1Ch3y3NeAZu8BqaEg.text: Nice little clean spot! Food is very fresh and flavorful. I got the Korean kalbi taco and my husband got the Cali burrito. We visited while on vacation, and I look forward to trying it again one day soon!

z1ETfKwn7yOy8cNVGEMYhg.text: Love the food there !  Great menu from salads to my favorite avocado tostado. If you want some quick and healthy Mexican food this is a great choice !!  Wonderful customer service also :)

cXbkqEmL4nrUaK3Hf2V_LQ.text: Everything on this menu is great! I go here often for lunch and order for my office regularly And they never disappoint. A few of my favorites are the black bean salad, the spicy bacon burrito, and the kalbi meat.

Llbf1IffzwE7Pam5kur1kQ.text: Awesome food!!! Fresh and clean. I'm so happy it's close to my home. Reminds me of being in California . Thanks for the great customer service. The second time I ordered thru Uber eats and it was still hot. My new favorite place .

9yygiIgoitFBp7vEKj_QsQ.text: Visiting family in Henderson and I always want to try Mexican food when I'm in NV.  We got 3 sets of taco meals. And one nachos with pollo.  Everything was fresh and flavorful. The salsas were all great!  The habanero one (yellow) was sweet and really spicy.  My mouth was burning but I couldn't stop eating it, was so good.   The ceviche was a great suggestion to eat with our chips and the two Aqua fresca's were delicious!  We got take out, but I loved seeing Malbec as a wine choice!   We will be back for sure.

KgkrhOuVL7VFuqYol2TnYA.text: Me gusta real authentic tacos. These aren't it! Staff was friendly, place was clean, and ambience was chill. But the food was eh! Over priced food and drinks. Including the aguas frescas and they're way to artificially sweetened. If you want some gringo style tacos then I guess this is your place. You want some yummy tacos with yummy salsas go somewhere else. Hell Ricos (delicious) Tacos El Tio is just up the way and fantastic. First and last visit for me

dK0Fwy5_ihKu5f1sCNOygw.text: Decent prices. Great location. Ordered the 3 taco plate. The tortillas weren't great, tasted like they were straight out of the package. Not fried or warmed. The hibiscus drink (tea?) was extremely watery.

8jIRo6oMjea6zFVEyL95JA.text: I went here on a whim because I was craving tacos and it did not disappoint! I had the carnitas and chicken tacos and the strawberry lemonade agua fresca. The tacos were delicious and I was pleasantly surprised with the amount of meat they put in each taco. The pico and avocado on top was just perfect. They have a variety of house made salsas to choose from to accompany your meal. The tacos came with a side of chips which tasted very fresh; next time I'll order a side of guac to go with my chips! The agua fresca was very refreshing and not too sweet at all. The staff were all very nice and professional, and the restaurant itself looked very clean. I will definitely be coming back here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Me Gusta Tacos - Henderson, NV, United States

RXdFoQuGjnMg9a6Is0Z-gA.text: Pineapple basil drink is tasty and the service is friendly but their carne asada tacos have to be one of the worst I've had in town and ridiculously overpriced given its size, quality and location. Tacos El Gordo and Taco y Taco tacos are not only much tastier but much cheaper and represents a greater value in every sense of the word. I'm quite disappointed given how it's expensive these tacos are. I wouldn't even buy it at $1 unless they improve the quality. Their habanero sauce is also similarly tasteless without the proper smoky fruitiness naturally present in habanero peppers.  Tacos from Me Gusta taste like subpar, overpriced tacos from the east coast. My apologies to the owner and cooks but there needs to be a serious revamping of the standard tacos.

tPuWAyofcXx9v0THXSijAw.text: I love coming to this location every one is very sweet.  It's convenient to order to go usually take 5 to 10 minutes.  The food is delicious and they have lots of options.  Coffee is great too.

ucZ_VdzLqQ8H3qTyPcIGrQ.text: Very cute and tasty! Love their salsa and tea selection. Their vegan taco was delicious!! 3 nice sized tacos with a side of tortilla chips. MEGA NICE STAFF! I'll definitely be back.

Etnb0io9_FFAnQg6YIU6aQ.text: Great food and the best aqua fresca!!!! LoVe the barbacoa and korean beef. The sayces are aoooo good too!!

cy8Uz7ncb4qa8WqoUCG5og.text: I went there recently about a month ago and the food was really good. I tried their mixed drinks with the herb. Was very good. The workers were very nice and accommodating. Good atmosphere. I would definitely go back!

eFxnlZz2ePuX0DcmEDNpMA.text: How dare other people give this restaurant anything less than 5 stars?!?!?!  We stumble upon this place looking for frozen yogurt and my goodness! What a great find! The food is amazing! i had their me gusta bowl with chicken and mango salsa, the most amazing "healthy" food i ever had! Don't leave without trying the caramel churro as well..  Oh and the pineapple basil is so refreshing and not sweet at all, my type of drink..   I fell too fast and feel too much, its my first time here and this place has become an instant favorite! The owner talked to us and seems like a nice guy! Will totally be supporting this local business..

m_3Vd7ndFDSJj3tpyWOIbw.text: Tried this place for the first time the other day. The service behind the counter was friendly. I thought the food was delicious and so was the tea. I would definitely come here again! A++

-m_yI-p8F5sAF9rceMCHEA.text: I LOVE this place... my favorite is the black bean salad with chicken!! The cilantro salsa goes perfect with it too. Whenever I'm at the District, I make sure to grab a bite here!! Highly recommend this spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Me Gusta Tacos - Henderson, NV, United States

jCFYNmUp6h5A3qYhrmpjpw.text: Ive eaten here twice now and both times were really good. The tacos are street style are really filed with stuff. The carne asada is my favorite, Tried the pork belly ban mi taco, delicious. They ague frescas they have are tasty too. Nice and friendly staff that work there too

photos.caption: Photo of Me Gusta Tacos - Henderson, NV, United States. Black bean salad with carne

BW51pdDyHCsrbalwY6KWeg.text: I scarfed my food and forgot to take pictures!  Ordered the pork belly, kalbi, and fish tacos.  Pork  belly was my favorite.  With the pickled daikon and carrots... So good.  I also had a horchata.  And in all honesty it was good, but just gritty.  Way too much cinnamon!  I don't know if it was just the bottom of the barrel, or how they make it, but it was way gritty.  I was disappointed too in the homemade salsas.  Although the tacos didn't really need it, the salsas tasted rather plain.  They were on the watery side, and lacked complexity of flavor.  My Mexican friends tell me that the salsa is what sets places apart, and for me the salsa here was just a let down.  Too simple, and lacked complexity of flavor.    I will return here.  They really do make their motto of "simple" taste good!  Next thing to try - the burritos!

CRO4vFwc-aUxZWoRCAKFww.text: Fresh and delicious! This cute, but slightly hidden, little store is amazing. The Korean tacos and shrimp burrito were very fresh and the loaded tots were delicious. The seating both inside and out is plentiful in this delightful little shopping square. Great food, great location and excellent customer service. I would definitely recommend this spot to others and will visit again when we are back in Nevada!

7DsxTLzn9YRJp84IVre8Zw.text: Delicious tacos! A little on the pricey side, but considering they are on the gourmet side of the taco spectrum it was pretty worth it. Quaint little seating area, the food came out fast and the service was good. They have a few beers and wines on tap too which is awesome! I tried the chicken, Barbacoa and steak tacos. Giving it 4 stars only because the barbacoa taco was pretty greasy and caused my other two tacos to get kinda soggy :/ other than that, the tacos are delicious and the salsa is amazing too!

photos.caption: Photo of Me Gusta Tacos - Henderson, NV, United States. Barbacoa, steak and chicken tacos

45XWcRVSHXrGTShq7ESK2A.text: OUTSTANDING FOOD! ..... This place rocks!!  .....Do yourself a favor and go try Me Gusta Tacos.... I haven't tasted anything that I didn't like.  The salads, tacos, nachos, all excellent.  It's my families new "favorite place"......

Q-XZV9FPMyv7o18-4sVmtQ.text: Food was okay nothing special for the price. The steak felt like it was beef not carne asada (don't know how to explain this any better).    That loaded tots were good. I'll go back but no rush.   Service was good and overall food was good not great. Very clean. The Fresca was good also. Not 5 star for steak being subpar

quKD0hI8QCK_d4D3mSp3FQ.text: Came here last night with a bunch of friends. The food was great and the customer service is just as good. I don't usually write reviews here on yelp expect when I encounter a place with good food and excellent service. Highly, highly recommend this place.   To the staff: keep up the great service!!! It make all the difference.

JMBoHVM4_op6DYzobXTn4w.text: Great fusion tacos.  Tried the carnitas,barbacoa and korean kalbi.  All great.  Fresh ingredients with fast service.

OmvqjtcgaXZi3liqvRX4og.text: My husband and I had one of the best urban Mexican food in the suburban area of Las Vegas! I loved the shrimp burrito.

tK4JHoteBWZHTLlkDodTwQ.text: NOTHING SPECIAL, DONT DO IT! Very very disappointed! I ordered uber eats carne asada tacos. First, MEAT tasted pan cooked, soggy, over cooked and tasteless. Generic corn tortillas. Not enough LIMES literally they give you a quarter of a lime for three tacos. SALSA needs flavor. FOR THE PRICE YOU PAY THEY DONT GIVE YOU GUACAMOLE OR BEANS...AND THEY RAN OUT OF ALL THE FRESH DRINKS, yeah thanks a lot... ur welcome for my business, never again.

5ZSVbas1TsNQbrEbCKVbOg.text: The tacos are really good. The barbacoa is a little messy, so grab extra napkins. Tacos come with some chips, but I'd order more since they're so good and you can add a side of fresh guacamole for extra.   The agua fresca is good, I prefer the strawberry lemonade. It tastes fresh and made from real fruit. Very refreshing.   The shrimp ceviche is really good. Good to share for an appetizer for two.   Churros are delicious and warm.   Definitely recommend this restaurant!

ZQJAGf2k8QV8-FmxP6WCsw.text: The tacos weren't bad but not extraordinary. I actually have had better. I found the meat to be a bit bland and kind of on the skimpy side. However, service was friendly and the place was very clean.

aBdbNLTwjZgkwA8ljoFC_w.text: Wow. Kalbi cali burrito is delish! Crunchy tots are substituted for fries.  Definitely an affordable place to stop by for some quick Mexican-Korean fusion while you're in The District.  Pineapple Basil agua fresca may not be everyone's favorite but still a must try.

xjnog8p5vrzcIJygqhTpIQ.text: Love the idea of the fusion tacos. Had the carne asada, Kalbi and bahn mi. All were really good. Bahn mi was my favorite!

6P5xuSjijGKIRTc3pq88Xg.text: Fresh, quick service tacos located near the splash pad at the District! You get 3 tacos for around $10. You can mix and match tacos and the nachos are yummy too!  They have kids options and drink options. Staff was great and the place was nice and clean. It's a pretty small space so seating is limited and the outside seating is mostly parents with their kids playing in the water.   An awesome location to grab a bite if you are at the splash pad and get hungry.

rY2EneYdE9ncvULipBEbUA.text: This place has some good fresh wholesome tasting food. This to me is sort of a modern twist on Mexican flavors and they deliver on some good fusion. I've had both bowls and tacos with almost all the meats, barbacoa is ok and same with the chicken, but kalbi in my opinion has the most flavor. The me gusta bowl is delicious and you can choose your meat and comes with avocado and red cabbage and mango which adds a nice sweetness. They also make delicious churros that are the perfect texture. Overall pretty solid stuff, almost perfect.       4.5/5

dgT-yjsXHgZYqJXPx9wM0A.text: We stumbled across this restaurant after going to REI and found it to be an amazing place with awesome food and service. The pork belly, carnitas, and Korean tacos were among our favorites. It's small inside but plenty of outside seating with a nice vibe. And the service was exceptional, the staff was very friendly to us. All in all we had a great experience and would definitely come again.

tDU1WFmGyo7HpJ26gfCRDg.text: I loved the California burrito with Kalbi  seriously so tasty and meaty!! Their menu isn't huge but it's definitely worth trying. I also tried the hibiscus Fresca and all 3 salsas.

lI4O6OOIUd6OZKhTziAmAg.text: Stopped here on the way to the  Hoover Dam -- and I would go back in a heartbeat. I was vacationing in Vegas, but wish I could take this place back home with me. Had the tacos and burritos -- excellent! Lovely area as well just adds to the experience.

Z4NsoocSlbKg5J1_S6A9ag.text: Amazing customer service and great food. This is a must try when in the district Area.  Highlights:  -California burrito -Pork belly tacos

SX1kh6hCK01B84nmyNjywQ.text: Such a good find in Henderson, I would highly recommend eating here if you're ever in town. Also, the District area is a nice, clean place to relax and get away from all that is Vegas.

8dZqA5puIjZWDXtbaaKKBg.text: Recently bought a place in Henderson so checking out the area around my place.  Found MGT on Yelp and decided to give it a try.  I ordered the the Kalbi, Pork, and Fish tacos.  Everything came out delicious and yummy, although the pork one is the on "dry" side however still taste great.  The missing star is because the price is a bit steep for a taco... Friendly staff and yummy food, will be back.  :)

po58Vxp3rAwjHmdYPCkd1Q.text: Super friendly service. Food was amazing! The chicken was to die for, so delicious.  Oh and as a tip, only the most daring should try that habanero salsa    it was good though

ufSQjXIGJTB-7jESvRQiXA.text: This is hands down my favorite taco spot. Although it isn't only a taco spot. The food is top quality, the service impeccable and the place provides a bright, fresh atmosphere. Their reasonably priced menu offers an array of items that cater to the most difficult palates and restricted diets - from Pork Belly Bahn Mi tacos, which everyone I bring here loves, to Vegetarian Tacos, which I love, to their Me Gusta Bowls (just try it!). Everything I've ever tried here is flawlessly prepared and delicious!  Sin lugar a dudas, este es mi sitio para tacos favorito. Aunque no es solo para tacos. La comida es de suprema calidad, el servicio impecable y el sitio tiene un ambiente fresco y alegre. Su menu abarca una variedad de platos, todos a precios razonables, los cuales acomodan el paladar mas dificil y la dieta mas restringida. Tienen desde Pork Belly Bahn Mi's, lo cuales les encantan a todo el que traigo aqui, hasta tacos vegetarianos, los cuales me encantan a mi!, y tambien los Me Gusta Bowls (solo pruebalo!). Todo lo que he probado aqui ha estado preparado a la perfeccion y delicioso!

zUAHfKAF9x00gARt8yWrBw.text: It was my first time here. My review is bias cause I'm not usually not a fan of fusion food. But we wanted to try this place (I had no idea it was fusion tacos). The tacos lacked flavor and the Korean kalbi tasted like teriyaki beef jerky. So they weren't my favorite. BUT I did enjoy the tater tots nachos. They don't have a soda fountain, they have some juices to choose from and a small selection of bottle sodas. It was a little disappointing considering what we paid for our meal, I guess I was just expecting a little bit more. If someone enjoyed fusion flavors, they might enjoy this spot. It just wasn't my cup of tea.

CYslxm0dF18uy5y09yEfZw.text: This place isn't too bad but it's not great. Prices are on part w gvr area, about $9 for a burrito. These are fusion style burritos, not authentic Mexican, even tho i went w your standard carne asada. The meat was powdery/mealy, didn't taste fresh. Lacked the chewy bite of steak. It was similar to when you leave a lean cut of beef in the slow cooker for too long.   The salsas were ok. I appreciate that they aren't too spicy. Since I've been pregnant i can't eat nearly as spicy as i used to. The verde was rated at a 6 out of 10 and the red was 4. They both were like a 2. I was afraid to try the last one which was rated 9.   The chips tasted light and fresh tho, and w a Yelp check in you get a free agua fresca. I got pineapple basil, the best part of my meal. I am going to try to replicate this at home.  Service was cordial yet minimal interaction was had. The dining space is pretty sparse inside, so since it was a gorgeous day, we sat outside. My dining companion got the quinoa bowl w added chicken. It was a generous portion and her go-to when eating here. She had about half leftover to take home. I ate all my food however.

photos.caption: Photo of Me Gusta Tacos - Henderson, NV, United States. Carne asada mission burrito $9 and some change after tax. Comes w a side a chips. Shown w pineapple basil agua fresca, free w Yelp check in!

1cV1MFXKLK2CHalW5gVvhw.text: Me Gusta Tacos is not authentic Mexican food.  It's kind of a hybrid/fusion place with tacos inspired by various genres, most of which are spot on.  Try the pork belly tacos!!! My only critique is that the salsa is blended and as a result often tastes watery and processed. I think a more traditional pico would be a good offering. Will definitely be going back.

HDKncLvZBvGerXe7JxcebQ.text: Located at the District this small taco shop offers fresh and delicious tacos! The menu is small but very appealing, keeping it simple is the way to go. I must comment on the first thing I noticed walking in is the restaurant is noticeably clean!The employees were very nice and patient. I had the vegetarian taco and a carne asada taco. My husband had the fish, shredded chicken as well as carne asada tacos Everything was fresh and very flavorful.  3 tacos for $9.75 or one for $3.50. Our tacos were served with tortilla chips. You help yourself to several different homemade salsas that's in a mini fridge on the counter. The burritos looked great and will try that next.

I loved how each one has its own flavor and toppings. Each order of 3 tacos came with tortilla chips on the side.  The steak was my favorite of the 3.  I also ordered a side of Spanish rice and guacamole.   This restaurant was located in a strip mall type of area. Lots of outdoor shops and small restaurants surrounded it.   This place was small inside but most people ordered to go. They did have a few tables if you wanted to eat inside.

AHZXIH6QaBJ0Z94-qH64hA.text: I have been coming here for years and it's always been consistently delicious! The owners clearly take pride in their business and everyone is friendly. The food is fresh and delicious every time. You have the option to dine inside our outside. They have fresh homemade salsas in a mini fridge for you to enjoy.   I have had almost every taco on the menu and my current favorite is the pork belly ban mi! The carne asada is tender and flavorful, and the shrimp is always fresh and perfectly prepared. If you manage to save room for desert there's a selection of churros to choose from as well.   This is the perfect spot to grab a quick and delicious bite while shopping in the district.

pgjTlBu6yF83g9EJ-4czTQ.text: This is a wonderful place for lunch or if you are craving tacos. I love the clean and bright layout of the restaurant. The staff is friendly and went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed. It's nice that you can also take your food to go outside.   My boyfriend and I cant stop talking about the pineapple basil aqua Fresca. We each tried several of their tacos and will be back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Me Gusta Tacos - Henderson, NV, United States

kv_gp5ddQry0jetqDzfliw.text: When I got over the grammar issue in their restaurant name (I'm a Spanish teacher and am used to being a grammar nazi, especially in Spanish), I stepped through the door and was kindly welcomed in by a lovely, humble young lady.  She got our order of a trio of tacos (carne Asada, Al Pastor and Barbacoa) started straight away and also advised on some sangria concoctions they can mix up for you!  The restaurant itself is open, light and decorated simply but tastefully with mosaic tile and there's plenty of seating at the clean tables inside and out.  We arrived as the sun was setting and decided to sit at the high tables outside where a colleague found us very shortly afterwards with our order.  The tacos were delicious!!! The meat is soft and pink but cooked and seasoned really well. Each are plentiful with meat as well as the other ingredients and the sangria mix was strong but refreshing and light.  Was so impressed! The only reason I drop a star is because the portion sizes are a little small for the price you pay. I have to imagine their location means their prices need to be inflated slightly higher than being somewhere else but for $10, we definitely had just a snack that kept us going in between meals.

photos.caption: Photo of Me Gusta Tacos - Henderson, NV, United States. Trio of tacos - Carne Asada 5/5, Al Pastor 4.5/5 and Barbacoa 4/5
Photo of Me Gusta Tacos - Henderson, NV, United States

-bW5g0imKt8F5vORx0Q_6Q.text: friendly worker.. food came out fast. was never told about the salsas. it looked like they were for sale. consistency looked like a smoothie. got chicken and carne asada taco. good and fresh but very dry. use the check in to get a free drink.

iRPDSszN27FIxedmmRnw_A.text: I had tried Me Gusta Tacos at various events which they catered. But I had never been to their physical location at The District. I was in the area this afternoon, though, waiting to see a movie at Green Valley Ranch. I knew Me Gusta Tacos was near by so I headed that way to check it out.  I was torn between a burrito and tacos when I first started looking at the menu. When I settled on a burrito I was torn between a California and a Mission burrito. One has tater tots and I do love potatoes in a burrito. The other has rice and gucamole.  I love rice and guacamole in a burrito more than potatoes so I went with the Mission burrito with carne asada. I also ordered an agua fresca, cantaloupe, as it came free with a Yelp check-in.   My drink came out fast. As it was brought to my table I was shown the salsas in the fridge next to me. I tried the drink first. Very refreshing. More cantaloupe flavor than a normal cantaloupe usually has. Not too sweet. A good beverage. My burrito came up a few minutes later. It was cut in half and I could see what was inside. Mostly rice. A little meat. A spread of guac. And some pico de gallo. But mostly rice. The flavor was fine. No one ingredient overpowered the others. The steak was tender but there wasn't as much of it as you might recieve from some other burrito places. All in all, not a bad burrito but a little pricey for mostly rice.  I moved on to the salsa when I finished my burrito and all I had left was chips. I wanted all three salsas, roja, verde and habanero. The salsa rojo was the most mild at a 4 out of 10 heat rating. The verde was a 6 of 10. And the habanero a 9. The roja would have been fine if that is al they offered but it is relatively bland compared to the others. The verde was sour notes of tomatillo and a little spicy kick. The habanero, my favorite, packs a punch but is not so hot that it is unpleasent. It has a delicious tropical fruitiness to it. Pineapple? Mango maybe? Whatever it is they use pairs well with the habanero and makes a very enjoyable salsa.  Service was good today. The agua fresca was a delight. The chips and salsa were a flavor packed addition. The burrito was good but not great. 3.5 rounded up to a 4 today for the good that outweighs the not as good. I had a good lunch and nobody can take that away.

El7MjOu_3pNexnshl13VJg.text: Had a craving for some tacos one day and saw this place nearby. The tacos were pretty good. 3 tacos for about $10, but for that price and the size of the tacos it was a bit high. I've been to other taco places where the portions/sizes were bigger.   So I got the Carnitas, Korean Kalbi, and Charboiled Carne Asada. The Korean Kalbi and Carne Asada were definitely my favorite! The kalbi was tender and flavorful. The Asian coleslaw balanced out the sweet and salty taste of the marinated beef. The Carne Asada was the same with its topping, pico de gallo and queso fresco. Very delicious! As for the Carnitas, it was my least favorite because it was way too wet! What I mean is there was too much of the liquid pork goodness in the taco that made it hard to eat and very mushy. The tortilla fell apart after my first bite and the liquid was dripping down all over my hands. I know eating tacos isn't one of the eloquent meals and you need to get messy, but too messy where it ruins the meal and taste of the taco is not so good.   With the whole 3 tacos, it also came with some tortilla chips. Now that was very good. Warm, crispy, crunchy! I definitely like that it wasn't all stale and cold like if someone just got it from a big bag brought from some warehouse. So if that's the case, thumbs up for not doing that. (Dont quote me cause I don't know if it's True or not lol) Anyways, I also brought a side of guacamole. The guac came in a one of those plastic cups and it was $2.50. Again, for me the size and price doesn't really correlate with each other and I thought was a bit high. However, due to the restaurant's area it's explainable for the price.   Other than that, the tacos taste delicious and the service was good. They had three different types of hot sauces varying spicy-levels in their small fridge, but I couldn't find any salt or pepper. I wanted to sprinkle some salt over those chips after a squeeze of lime on top, but couldn't.

photos.caption: Photo of Me Gusta Tacos - Henderson, NV, United States. 3 tacos: Korean Kalbi, Charboiled Carne Asada, Carnitas

rHB_51CfvT8yDMR7ii2xxg.text: Excellent "go-to" for street tacos, especially the Pork Belly Bahn Mi Tacos - my favorite!   Casual ambience...Also loved the Frescas.  Their motto "make simple better" - YES!

mVoArx2V1nFWwkv8-tec3A.text: Aaaah YES!!! Creative and tasty tacos!!!! Great vibes over from the location, staff and others at the restaurant. Never heard one bad thing about Me Gusta Tacos, so I decided to give it a try....didn't regret that decision. That Korean taco...guuuuurrrlllll, lemme tell YOU!!!! Sooo amazing!!! Add some of the homemade salsa with a beer...and my friends, you will have a serious mouth watering experience!!! This place is ROCKIN!! Definitely will visit again!!!

f0WhDatSf-4qUvfS4mVwkw.text: This restaurant has some of the best tacos I've had. I indulged in their fish taco as well as their Durango burrito. Both tasted extremely fresh and were very filling. What set this restaurant apart from most restaurants, was their salsas. Unfortunately, I am just a passerby to the area but wish I could bring the restaurant with me. Definitely recommend you try the delicious food. They also offer vegetarian options for those green eating individuals.

48oOU9ZsingsZUU_G3Yn4A.text: Tacos and nachos are a couple of my favorite foods. I crave these on a weekly basis :P I was so happy to see all the positive reviews on Me Gusta Tacos, but I was slightly disappointed. Don't come here expecting authentic Mexican food... it's far from that. It's good for what it is, but just not the best tacos you can get. Honestly, I'd come back if I don't feel like driving super far for some legit tacos, but I'd never crave this place.  Sauces on the other hand, are REALLY good.

Iuj-p1MZRKNplBbBDsLlUg.text: This place is always 5 stars. They've always had options available for me (whatever crazy way I'm eating) I've had their fish tacos, their veggie tacos, and my most recent meal was a salad that was very fresh and delicious.

cEqYRCDSfVElJ3kQrD4NDA.text: Walking through the District trying to figure out what to eat for dinner. Came across this place. I DO NOT recommend this place! Not even an ounce of authenticity at all!!! I know I know..should've gone to Roberto's. But it was a beautiful night and this was the only option for mexican food. I ordered the nachos. Hardly ANY cheese whatsoever! Beens taste like they were out of a can. Carne asada had pieces that were two toned and tasted really weird.  This is actually my first negative review on Yelp  Save your money and do not come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Me Gusta Tacos - Henderson, NV, United States

6O2djNjNvTWLTT-WkRNnPA.text: I love this place. I go to lifetime gym across the street so it's a really convenient choice for a post workout meal. The staff is great, the environment is clean and the food is tasty, clean, and consistent. I can always count them for a high quality meal at a decent price with fast service without rushing me to the bathroom haha.   In my opinion, the freshest tasting meat will be the Korean kalbi, barbacoa, and the carne asada. The fish tastes too fishy and the chicken is kind of bland for my liking. This place is very simple and clean. I love the food here for 3 reasons. Simplicity, consistency, and the fact that it's one of the only taco/burrito spots that doesn't ruin my stomach if you know what I mean. I'd rather not spend 30mins hogging the bathroom after a meal haha. I have a very sensitive stomach and almost every other fast-casual Mexican cuisine will ruin my stomach. So I love that I can enjoy this food and not feel GUILTY afterwards.

photos.caption: Photo of Me Gusta Tacos - Henderson, NV, United States. 2 barbacoa tacos, 4 fish tacos, steak and egg burrito without tortilla, and the mission burrito w/ Korean kalbi and no rice or cheese

mTDdxMSAZw3O_eI7XRcOBQ.text: This place is so amazing! I tried 3 different tacos (pork belly banh mi, barbacoa,and korean kalbi) and every single one was delicious! Highly recomend. Price pretty normal, about $10 a meal give or take. Try it out!

X6dXsocFMZi-hu3MTHTJEA.text: Me Gusta is a unique version of the classic taco shop and perfect for the Green Valley District vibe. They have all the classic Mexican flavors you'd expect, but done a little more refined and with attention to detail that can sometimes slip through the cracks at a "standard" taqueria. They also have some interesting fusion tacos that can't be missed- the Korean Kalbi BBQ is out of this world flavorful and a perfect marriage of the two cuisines!   The only thing that holds these tacos back from a perfect five stars is the tortilla; they are wonderfully fresh, loaded with filling, but often fall apart as a result while eating and that's a bummer. I also would like to see a bit more variety in their salsa selection. They have three options, all very tasty, but two are pretty similar in my opinion and the third is good- but it is SPICY! I can handle a decent amount of heat and it gets me sometimes. It would be nice if they had a more middle of the road salsa (heat wise) as the two similar salsas are more mild, but differ in flavor/texture a bit.

photos.caption: Photo of Me Gusta Tacos - Henderson, NV, United States

JHz4RM9YMUyRs2l8F0xeNQ.text: Looking for something different in the District I stopped in me Gusta for lunch. The menu offered basic Mexican style food, some with a twist with all Natural Meats, Sustainable Fish and Real Fruit Agua Fresca. -I decided to try the California burrito. You get to choose your protein, mine was Kalbi, and it comes with tater tots, cheese and sour cream. A small side of chips on the side and I ordered a side of guacamole. Kalbi had excellent flavors and I like the crunchy tots vs potatoes or fries. I wasn't sure about the pineapple mint aqua fresca before order but glad that I did. Not one flavor dominated the other and it was very refreshing. Can't wait to get bake to try more of their menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Me Gusta Tacos - Henderson, NV, United States. Kalbi Cali with side guacamole. Pineapple basil aqua Fresca

aYFNpVZiwWab_ZMEDaZMyg.text: It was ok, but I wasn't blown away. My wife and I both got 3 taco plates with 3 different tacos each, so we tried 6 of their taco selections. If you are aiming for healthy, gluten free, etc, it's probably great. Add a star. But if you're just looking for delicious tacos and don't care about that other stuff, try Rubio's, Cafe Rio or someplace more authentic like Taco y Taco. They also have burrito's and a few other selections, so it's possible I'd like those things more, but they are supposedly known for their tacos, which I found mediocre. Most of the ones we tried were either one note flavors or the meat was dry and tough. The only one my wife and I both liked was the carnitas.   My wife and I are big on ambience when we choose where to eat. This place has none. The inside is stark, brightly lit and uninviting. There is some seating outside by the splash pad in The District, which can be nice for families, but we don't have kids and don't particularly care for unsupervised children running amok and screaming in our faces while we are trying to enjoy a meal. Call me old fashioned, but there it is.   I will give a nod to the service. Our server was great. When we didn't like the aqua fresca we tried, she gave us another flavor no charge. And when they accidentally gave our churro out with another order, they gave us two in it's place. For that reason alone, if I were in the district and in the mood for healthy, sustainable, responsible food, I'd try getting it to go and eating it somewhere else.

aNoYd9xgZ7p5leKuiGIrCg.text: I have been here about 4-5 times now and really enjoy the simplicity and flavors of this place.  1. Burritos - mainly came here for the burritos and had both the California, Anthem and Mission Burrito over several times.  California - Had both the carnitas and the kalbi burrito of this and it is very fresh and tasty.  Anthem - This is more of a vegetarian style burrito with beans, cheese and avocado and squash.  Also tasty, you really don't miss the mean and my daughter makes this her Vegan favorite by cutting out the cheese.  2.  Beer and Wine - Yes, I enjoy having a glass of beer or wine at times with my dinner and it is great that they have a license.  You can sit in or outside and enjoy the weather, the water park, the kids playing, the band when there is one, and eat, drink and be merry.  3.  The weather - We all know in summer it can get hot.  The best thing is that in the mornings, Me Gusta is positioned on the west side and they get a lot of shade, so it can still be very nice and pleasant to enjoy and relax.  4.  Agua Fresca - Interestingly, they have fresh water mixed with fruit, mint and these are very refreshing!  I have tried a few of their flavors. They make them fresh and they change it up and if you want a very cold and refreshing drink that is healthy, check it out!  If you are a meat eater, or a vegetarian, this is a place that has options for you  and they can make it your way.   GK Says, check it out.  It is one of our favorite places now!

Gmp-WpzoO3Xj2CjyenQ_qQ.text: Awesome food and a nice, simple atmosphere. Appreciate the kindness of staffers. Good variety on the menu and food is made very timely so I'm not waiting around for long

bRxTFWJms0w84Qv256ykfA.text: I came here on my birthday because of Instagram photos I came across and heard it's a must try. So I decided to try their surf n turf burrito and added a nice cold beer to my order. I sat outside and enjoyed my delicious meal. Looking forward to going again!! Yummy!

7tZmWzCiQfJcZS7iP1hekQ.text: This kind of place is EXACTLY what the District needed. High quality, affordable and quick modern Mexican cuisine.   I tried the Carne Asada, Carnitas and Korean Kalbi tacos. All three were phenomenal- seriously some of the best proteins I've ever had. I also enjoyed their salad and guacamole.   This is the kind of place that will keep me from going to Chipotle ever again...   I highly recommend trying this place before it gains too much popularity in the District because it's definitely going to happen! Killer job Me Gusta!

I did that, and I ended up choosing the watermelon, hands down. The Watermelon Mint is their most popular, according to the cashier, and deserving so. I thought it was the best out of the drinks. Very refreshing watermelon coolness with a hint of mint.  I went on a Saturday evening, and there was live music outside with a bunch of children playing in the water. Grab some tacos and enjoy.

4pMgSygPJ-mNX3Q6MKFYwA.text: Love this place. I've been coming here since it opened and I can't believe I've never written a review. Kind, clean, service and environment. delicious and fresh food. Very convenient in summer when the splash pad is on with the kids (the splash pad is shaded from about 3:30 onwards due to the buildings which is nice).

kBe6FtvlmZp0ZEnCFBJFRg.text: Don't judge a book by its cover they say and this totally applies to Me Gusta Tacos... In a bad way. They're located right by the fountains at The District, cute outdoor seating. The restaurant is very hipster and simple. Only a couple of tables inside and the inside echoes so much that you probably won't want to sit in.  We ordered the California burrito which turned out to be pretty bland. There are salsas in the fridge inside, however none were at all spicy. The whole meal was just boring :(  Me Gusta Tacos is cute, but the food turned out to be extremely disappointing. They serve alcohol and fresh juices so I'll have to try that in the future. They have a lot of potential, hopefully things improve with time!

JxeCckVNgC8kfjegR1GtBg.text: Me Like, You Like, We both like Tacos!!!!! Me Gusta Tacos delivers on providing mouth watering and healthy tacos.  In my opinion, they are serious contenders that puts them near the top of my list as one of the best tacos in town.  They also have enticing breakfast menu as well and is served all day.   I ordered a variety of tacos, all these were really delicious on there own.  The one commonality is the food tastes fresh and juicy. They make handmade soft corn tortillas, and the best salsas. You cannot eat a taco without salsa here, your missing out!!!  I recommend the Salsa Verde and the Habanero if you like spicy.    KOREAN KALBI - Korean Steak, Asian Cabbage Slaw SHREDDED POLLO - Chicken, Cheddar, Pico de Gallo, Avocado FISH - Sustainable Fish, Cabbage, Cilantro, Wasabi Crema CARNE ASADA - Traditional Marinated Steak, Pico de Gallo, Queso Fresco If had to pick a favorite its the Korean Kalbi - Korean BBQ in a form of a taco, my I can't resist that.  Say your in the mood for something sweet? The Venezuelan Chocolate Pancakes is heavenly and will satisfy your craving, just look at the picture.   Overall, this is a shot of adrenaline that Henderson needed. It's in a beautiful spot in the district, where people can relax and enjoy. Plus, the staff are pleasant and provide great customer service. Just by walking in,  wouldn't think they just opened.   I highly recommend checking out Me Gusta Tacos!

MUEG3vNeRJQI28TIShFOOw.text: Yum!   We ordered delivery through ubereats, and it was so good! The carnitas burrito was good but the cinnamon threw us off, however the filling ratio on the burrito was great, you didn't get a bite of one thing then something different.. it was perfectly layered so you got a bite of everything with each bite.    Pork belly tacos= amazing!  Kalbi beef tacos= meh, ok.. kalbi I've had in the past was super tender and not chewy, this kalbi beef was very chewy and  it made the taco fall apart..   They swapped my tortilla chips for a small side of tater tots which was nice because I didn't want a ton of tortilla chips. Well, turns out they're extra delicious with the homemade salsas they provide..   I want to go here sometime and try the food at the restaurant.

4vTEeC08vf2c2OnXhJuEWA.text: Fun drinking game: take a shot every time a yelper playfully incorporates "Me Gusta Tacos" in their review.   AnYwHoO ~ Let it be known that the day I visited Me Gusta Tacos was the day I borderline overdosed on their delicous churros.   CARAMEL CHURRO ($2.50) - 5/5 - Me gusta tacos pero me gusta churros tambien! YES, i know tacos are in their name but trust me their CHURROS ARE DROOL WORTHY and you can choose from a handful of fillings! Pipin' hot, generously coated in sugar and spice - yup it's everything nice in a churro. Better than Costco 4 sho. I ate 4 of them and took a dank nap after~ no ragrets.   THE ACTUAL FOOD: As their wall states, their food is simple, but it's scrumptious.   TACOS - 1 for $3.50, 3 for $9.50, 6 for $18. It's a step above my normal taco budget but you're paying for quality bruh! OH AND FREE CHIPS! Raid their salsa fridge to douse your chips and you'll be a happy camper.  FISH TACO - 5/5 - I'm not a big fan of wasabi, but their wasabi crema that lubricated the fish married the cabbage and cilantro nicely. The fish was flaky and delicious. Note that it's grilled, not battered and deep fried like most typical fish tacos - good move for the health conscious. Handmade corn tortillas? - made all the difference!  MISSION BURRITO ($8)- 4.5/5 - Rice, pico, guac, cheese and your choice of meat - i got the kalbi. Love how they toast their burritos so there's a subtle crunch. Check out my pic, SUPERB meat to rice ratio!!! My only complaint is that I felt like the kalbi asian flavor was lost with the other components on the burrito - i wish they had a more asian flavors-centered burrito that incorporated kimchi and/or their asian slaw to complement the kalbi. Still a delicious burrito tho, can't deny that.  WATERMELON MINT AGUA FRESCA ($3.50) - 5/5 - Sublime when you overdose on their habanero salsa. Refreshing. 10/10 would sip in vegas heat. No artificial flavorings here, this is the real deal.  BONUS POINTS: - they serve local Vegas brewed beer!! WHAAT!  - potted plants adorned on the wall = totez instagram worthy!  - BREAKFAST SERVED ALL DAY!! - freeload off the Williams Sonoma free wifi hehheheh  OVERALL: It's a delicious spin on quality, fresh Mexican food that even your yoga instructor will approve of. TRY IT!

e8K-OYuaJjirxJd7qEzMXQ.text: Dang, I was actually a little disappointed when I tried this place for the first time. It's literally called 'I like tacos' and I looooove me a good taco, which is mostly the main reason I finally tried this place after all this time.   Atmosphere is cool and neat inside, with a modern upscale twist on Mexican food. I opted to try their tacos since this place is named after tacos. I tried the vegetarian, chicken and pork. The vegetarian taco was ok, the spicy mayo/sauce on top was most flavorful. The chicken and pork in the tacos were juicy, but not as flavorful as I had hoped. I took this meal to go and spruced it up a little at home with some hot sauce. Best part is having different options to choose from; 3 tacos of your choice for $9.   I also tried the side of corn and bacon, a friend of mine recommended I try this. They were not stingy with the bacon whatsoever!!! Bacon lovers, this ones for you.   Perhaps next time I'll try a burrito or quesadilla, something with a little more flavor to my liking.

XPNxI_RqJw7KY7P7xVt0mQ.text: Me gusta tacos a lot, but on my visit to Me Gusta Tacos I decided to go with the nachos and I was not disappointed.  I dined here with about a dozen hungry friends after participating in a 5k nearby. Me Gusta Tacos is clean and bright inside, but it's a on the small side .There is plenty of seating outside near the splash pad though!   Service was really friendly and they brought our food out quickly. My nachos with carne asada added were super tasty and very filling. The ingredients were fresh and the meat was well seasoned. I also enjoyed a delicious agua fresca that was free with my Yelp check-in!

HKnvd-aD13-xv6lanZuXyA.text: First thing, first - CHECK IN ON YELP! I checked in AFTER I paid only to find out I could've gotten my delicious Strawberry Lemonade Agua Fresca for free!   Second, their 3 taco combo is an awesome deal at $8+change but keep in mind that the tacos are not small like I thought them to be.. especially the carnitas taco which is filled to the brim with delicious, smoky tender pulled pork. Not to mention that it comes with chips and salsa. I was full halfway through my second taco but NEED TO PUSH THROUGH! The KBBQ taco is very good-- kalbi is super tender and flavorful. I also got the fish taco and, honestly, it wasn't my favorite. Not huge on the spicy horseradish-esque sauce. The tacos each have their blend of fresh pico, sauces, and slaw to complement the flavors. I hope to try their Cali burrito next time.. maybe in a bowl?  I had Me Gusta Tacos a few years ago at a YELP event but never got around to trying them again until today and I do not know why! I'm adding this place to my go to list of lunch at work. Perhaps I'll call in my order because the lunch rush is REAL.

fYBp6kBtF_8dnhsB8uSxUA.text: Stopped into grab a quick bite when we were in the area, and once again our fellow Yelpers did not disappoint! This place is solid!  You walk in and the decor is minimal, but very well done. The place was clean and there were some big tables on one side and a few small tables along the wall on the right.   The menu is well thought out and easy to read. The first thing that caught my eye was TATER TOTS! Are you kidding me?! Have all my dreams come True! I can feed my love for Mexican food and enjoy tots at the same time?!  So of course I opted for the California burrito, full of tots, sour cream, cheese, and your choice of meat!   Meat options are extensive, the options are: pollo, carnitas, barbacoa, pork belly, kalbi, and shrimp.   I chose barbacoa and I'd do it again in a heart beat! The meat was so nicely cooked- not tough or chewy.   The burrito came with a side of chips, and the cashier pointed us to a mini fridge filled with salsa and told us to help ourselves and pull bottles for the table! A great, less-mess, and fresh way to enjoy housemate salsas with your chips and burrito!   I wish we lived here just so we could frequently visit!   Needless to say we'll be back when we are in town! I'd have trouble straying from what I already ordered and loved, but their salad creations looked good, tacos looked great, and they have churros and loaded tots that I am sure are worth a shot!  Me gusts this experience and shop!

62gs5Enxa4Xd2SUSKi_lbQ.text: Really disappointed... I don't get why they have so good ratings. I've ordered a chicken taco, the chicken was completely dry, no taste. Not sure what to think but in all cases I don't recommend...

0sR8JaSX1TRUIbNPn0PZZQ.text: I hate to say it, but no me gusta Me Gusta Tacos.  I was able to sample the second location of this restaurant last year, and I finally got around to sitting down at their original spot in The District at Green Valley Ranch. Located on the same row as Brighton Collectibles and two neighboring bars, and now flanked by drinks and snacks spot Zero Degrees, this taco shop seems to be very popular on Yelp.  I did find some items which I'd order again if I bothered to go. Out of my order of three tacos ($9.50 for that count, $3.50 individually), I enjoyed the Pork Belly Banh Mi the most. The meat was tender and delicious, as was the marinade. I also tried two of the Agua Fresca ($3.50) selections and enjoyed both the pineapple basil and hibiscus, the former because it had the right flavors and was restrained in sweetness and the latter because it was also not too sweet and had a nice tartness. Finally, the Bavarian cream churro ($2.50) was a warm treat with both crispy and soft textures, and a pleasant cream filling to boot.  That's where my appreciation ends though. There was an overarching issue with all of the tacos: the tortillas, warmed or not, weren't oiled and cooked properly. They tasted as if you'd just grabbed them out of the bag. As for the fillings of the other tacos which I tried, the best I'd say is that they were not that exciting. The Korean Kalbi had nice steak, but the flavors was too sesame-centric. The Charbroiled Carne Asada read like cubes of soft beef rather than steak, and it wasn't sufficiently marinated compared to my favorite asada tacos in town. The Fish was the worst, remaining distressingly bland despite an interesting wasabi crema.  I did enjoy their salsa options, all of which come in squeeze bottles which you can grab from a conveniently accessed fridge. The salsa roja is really mild though, and I have no idea why it's labeled as 4 out of 10. The salsa verde is also not really a 6 out of 10. The salsa habanero lit my mouth on fire though, so its rating of 9 out of 10 is not as far off. Unfortunately, salsa needs a vehicle, and the chips on my taco plate were average and could've also come out of a bag.  I'll consider coming back to Me Gusta Tacos for some bowls/sides which I've tasted before. Also, I would like to have the pork belly again. That aside, there are too many issues for a place with Tacos in its name for me to recommend it over any of several authentic taquerias in town.

Photo of Me Gusta Tacos - Henderson, NV, United States. Churro ($2.50)

mmFqWOFOZkeu8mKsv1LjTw.text: My husband and I came in for an early dinner after some Christmas shopping. I knew nothing about this place and was pleasantly surprised!! We ordered 4 tacos between the 2 of us- 2 fish, 1 carnitas, and 1 barbacoa.   Both came with chips (which we weren't expecting!) and they have a little mini fridge with 3 types of salsa to self-serve yourself: red (mild), green (medium), habanero (hot).   Everything tasted super fresh and flavorful! I loved the green salsa for the tacos and the red for the chips. I didn't try the habanero cuz I'm a weenie!  They also have a burritos and bowls- I will be back to try some of their other options!

photos.caption: Photo of Me Gusta Tacos - Henderson, NV, United States

5Au6jnZ6S1V7iThtT8bQqg.text: This taco spot is my favorite in all of Henderson and Las Vegas! Absolutely awesome combination of flavors from their protein choices to their toppings and garnishments, and their complemented sauces!   My favorite dish here is the Surf and Turf burrito! The dish comes with some tortilla chips and is quite sizable. The shrimp pieces are large and meaty, along with the steak strips that are cut up and seasoned just right. I love the garnishments on there that you can add like the diced onions, fresh cilantro, and aioli if desired. This burrito has beautiful balance in texture and flavor and is not shy of the protein component. Great portions of every component to give it an outstanding zen. I love that they cut the burrito too to make it easier to eat.   Their salsas are honestly the best that I have ever tried. I lalalalove the habanero salsa with its subtle hints of citric acid and delicious pepper notes balanced with an undertone of sweetness. Absolutely delicious! Quality for a great price in my opinion!   I usually order from here through postmates, but I have yet to be disappointed when I add notes or side garnishments. Thank you Me Gusta Tacos team for astounding quality in food and service!

Qoahodv6qiylTTKBSPva0A.text: If I am in the Henderson and Green Valley area, I have to stop by Me Gusta Tacos. They are my favorite taco spot in the Henderson area. I can't wait to try their new concept, I am sure it lives up to the same type of standard. I'd recommend the Korean Kalbi, Pork Belly Banh Mi and Barbacoa tacos.

rKl8_oV_FUbMS44HWRgPuw.text: My boyfriend and I have come twice to the Green Valley Ranch Resort and each time we only eat at Me Gusta Tacos. We once came here 3 X in one visit. This place is the jam - great food and their burritos are out of this world.   FAST SERVICE and great vibe. we sat outside on cinco de mayo and enjoyed live music while enjoying our food.  i miss henderson! take me back to heaven! mi amor tacos..........

YTcN_GTLqBxCozXCrp9VMQ.text: I was super excited to try this place, especially since the pictures were very beautiful and majority of the items looked delicious.   Since my original dinner plans at King's Fish House didn't work out- I stopped in to try Me Gusta Tacos.  Overall the interior space is on the smaller side. There's about 4 tables inside, but since this establishment is across from the water fountain fixtures, there's areas to sit and enjoy your food.   I opted for the 3 tacos, mix n' match for $9.50. I ordered 2 carne asada and 1 Kalbi Beef. I love me some carne asada, and Kalbi Beef, so I started with the carne then had the Kalbi. If I can be completely honest, the meat here was super disappointing. First of all, the carne asada looked like cat food: dry, plus it had no real flavor. The Kalbi Beef also looked like cat food with no juicy flavor, dryyyyy. The meat also had a weird smell, as if it wasn't fresh. I did walk in 30 minutes prior to closing time, so maybe the meat was from earlier today- not fresh?   The chips that came on the side?! Meh, I've had better; some were crunchy, some were soggy- very inconsistent. The salsas, were okay. The Habanero (Yellow) has an initial sweet taste, then it just burns an uncomfortable feeling- I'd pass. The red salsa is super mild yet, the green verde salsa is not that bad. Of the 3, the green verde salsa is the most flavorful.   I'm glad I tried this place, now I know what it's all about and I most likely will not return for seconds.   I would drive all the way to Sharky's on Blue Diamond for some good Mexican Fusion food.

Photo of Me Gusta Tacos - Henderson, NV, United States

wJ0aW4rn46UgHL9ds8H2ag.text: Always happy when I come here. The Korean Kalbi tacos are phenomenal. One of my favorite bites of food in the city. Someone should have warned me how addictive they are, because now I crave them on a regular basis.  Full disclosure: I have been coming here for over a year now. They catered my wedding. The owners and staff are very professional and quality people. The food is always consistently good and restaurant is always spotless.  I've had everything on the menu and the only thing I don't LOVE are the chicken tacos. Just so plane compared to the other tacos that are lush with depth of flavor.  The price point is right too. $9.50 for 3 tacos and chips. Burritos all under $10. I have never left hungry.   If you haven't been here before or just want to try something different come here for a cheap, fun, and flavorful experience!

They also have house made hot sauce. If you check in you get a Agua Fresca! Will definitely be back if I am in the neighborhood.

3W3mFsKM2RobAXKlHu9oaA.text: So delicious. Found this place online. Came over to the district just to try it out for lunch. Yummy. Love the unique dishes. Staff is lovely. Ambiance is peaceful right near the outside area.

9Tw7AGCSq0XOkLU8zO0wEw.text: "I like tacos..." - George W. Bush  The short and sweet of it...Me Gusta Tacos serve really delicious street style tacos and burritos. Tried the Carnitas, the Carne Asada, and the Korean Kalbi Tacos (with corn tortillas)...all outstanding. Wife had the fish and the chicken tacos (with flour tortillas), she loved them. Also, ordered the stacked tots...tator-tots topped with melted cheese, sour crema, and a scoop of guacamole, wuz the best thing ever! Oh wait, the Bavarian cream churros wuz the best! They have freshly made juices and lemonades...strawberry-lemonade was very thirst quenching...and they also have some Mexican beers on tap. And oh yeah, salsa's located in a refrigerator up front...Legit tacos, bomb tots, churros, give it a try.

8bFN5ZOCheF75_T8GU-MaA.text: I was on the hunt for street tacos, but not those greasy conventional low-quality meat tacos. Then I stumbled upon Me Gusta Tacos.  I was hopeful it smelled great, simple atmosphere, friendly staff and amazing salsas! The Carne Asada tacos had a funny taste to the marinade wasn't too bad but the Carnitas tacos were so greasy and so fatty I couldn't even finish more than one taco. Over-priced in my opinion. I won't be back.

jiuTFdnDscrrc5wno-2nig.text: This place came highly recommended by my Henderson based friend, so we agreed to meet up for dinner here while my wife and I were in town.  I appreciated the simple menu.  It gave me confidence that everything we were about to order would be done well, and for the most part, it was.  We were greeted by the friendly staff who happily helped us out with all the questions we had.  They knew the menu well and were able to give us the details that we wanted.  They also offered us samples of their agua frescas which they were very proud of, though I didn't really care for them at all.   Our food came out and it was good, but I felt that it was a little lacking in the flavor department.  I ordered the carne asada burrito, and don't get me wrong, it was a good burrito, but I really wished there was some flavor that made the burrito "pop".  It's had to describe, but maybe some additional seasoning or longer marinade might have helped.  I'm not a food doctor so I admit that I am not qualified to diagnose what would have gotten this burrito another star, but overall I was still very glad we came here.  As a bonus, we got a churro before leaving and it was fantastic!

KmbtkSSsuZ034nUr8pKYCw.text: I've ate here twice. I was not impressed the first time but figured it deserved a second chance. Disappointed again. There's no flavor! The chicken and pork are bland and the carne asada tastes of cinnamon. The rice is moist but again, no flavor. I'm really baffled by this. Plus, it is pricey. I will not be going a third time. The two stars are for atmosphere, and the nice staff.

U_fynoUOveFaO_YdqhxF8Q.text: Really tasty food, but way over priced. Tacos are smaller than street tacos. Kids don't usually like black beans, but that is what the burritos are made of on the kids menu.

tbFI0SOzFO5eqdwj2-YftQ.text: Who cares if this is fusion Mexican food? It's food and great food at that. I can appreciate great food and great customer service. They made it a point to ask if i have ate here before when I walked up to the counter and welcomed me to ask questions if I needed to. I explained that I found there food page on "@lasvegasfoodie" on Instagram and had sent that page to my friend in Oregon to help make a decision for me! I'm glad I decided to come here. I was bummed to hear the Watermelon Mint agua fresca was sold out but after free samples I opted for the Strawberry Lemonade agua fresca. It only seemed right for this Californian to try the California Burrito: crunchy tater tots, mild cheddar, sour cream, with chicken and the added guacamole was a hit. I thought the chicken would be pieces and not shredded but it wasn't enough to disappoint me. Food is great, and people on here dissing fusion Mexican food should keep more of an open mind!

It said the pollo was a best seller but in my opinion the Korean beef was the best. I can't wait to come back here!

The husband and wife team, Sandra and Li have done a wonderful job creating a popular restaurant in the District in Henderson, which was crowded, even when not the tables outside, after only 9 days of being open.  The menu is well thought out, with all day breakfast, and a balanced selection of other dishes to choose from, including many vegetarian selections, some using sustainable fish, non-gmo ingredients, and other good stuff, make this a definite place to try for a meal.

eohDv6vLaXCzsqJFmW1DQA.text: My mom and I went here after shopping at the district on a Saturday afternoon. The taco shop wasn't too crowded so we got a spot at one of the high tables inside. They also have some spots outside of you prefer. We both got the vegetarian taco with chips. They have three different sauces that you can bring to your table. A classic red, a salsa verde and habanero salsa. All are so good but the salsa verde is my favorite. We also got a side of the creamy wasabi dressing to dip our tacos in..so yummy! The ingredients are all top quality and the restaurant is very clean. We only got waters to drink but they do have beer on tap and other Mexican specialty beverages available.  I will definitely go back to try more menu items.
